website_summaries.verdict: With its ultra-low-cost refillable ink bottles, this clever little Epson EcoTank printer does away with pricey ink cartridges once and for all -- but it will cost you a lot more up front.
pros: The Epson EcoTank ET-2550 is a multifunction printer, copier and scanner that can hold enough ink to last two years without a single refill
The subsequent refill bottles are also much cheaper than traditional cartridges, offering potential savings over the long-term
cons: The printer costs four to eight times more than cartridge-based models
It has a very minimal display and feature set, lacking an Ethernet port, fax functionality, auto-document feeder and duplexing

customer_reviews.title: No good.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the idea of cheap ink is appealing. Unfortunately, after you pay the outlandish price, you get poor printing --streaky, faded lines, etc. Don't be suckered by this one, like I was. The cheap ink will not make up for the initial cost, and you will be disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Laughably bad!
customer_reviews.text: Laughably bad, so bad that they include an instruction kit to send it back in the packaging. Paper needs to be loaded no more than 10 sheets at a time or it will display a paper jam warning. Often prints crooked on the page. I use this printer to print shipping labels for my online business and it has failed miserably.
customer_reviews.author: stangasm

customer_reviews.title: Good idea....terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest POS printer that Epson ever put their name on. I have used epson brand printers for 20 years... I've had to have this printer replaced twice already and a 3rd replacement is in the works! Heads/nozzles plug up constantly, and when you call tech support the first thing they want you to do is an ink flush. The only thing good about this printer is the cost of the ink bottles... would not recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Winczewski

customer_reviews.title: Decent prints for the first few months, then not so good
customer_reviews.text: This printer has amazing ink capacity, but very poor print quality. After a couple months, I start getting lines in my prints, almost like a clogged nozzle. The self-cleaning and alignment methods don't fix the issue. I recently tried printing a photo. I ended up just ordering a print. This printer is great for quick and dirty text prints, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisGeek

customer_reviews.title: Had terrible banding issues on the black
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 months. Had terrible banding issues on the black. Epson support sent out a refurbished one to replace it. The new one works fine, but for how long?? Same crap printer, they're just getting the money from you in front instead of a slow death thru ink purchases. Do with this info what you will.
customer_reviews.author: John M F

customer_reviews.title: Low quality output- not sure it is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality output. I like the fact that cartridges are not required, but there is a cost- very low quality print quality. My printed pages commonly have ink smears and missing pixels. It is just barely adequate, and sometimes not usable. 1/28/2017 Print quality just keeps getting worse- not really usable anymore. I do not recommend this printer. I liked the concept of avoiding cartridges, but this printer does not work. No more Epson printers for me!
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: So far, this has been a pretty awful experience. Printer won't keep wifi settings, won't print using USB connection, can't connect using the printer's wifi (doesn't even show on my computer as available). Also, I'm using the ink that came with the printer and I'm already getting lines that look like the print head is clogged. Right now, I can't do business because I need a WORKING printer to do invoices. And Epson, where is your product support number? Don't feel like talking with a customer? Rather have them post a one star review for you? Not only not inclined to keep this, but not inclined to go with Epson. ever. again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Epson ET-2550 Extreme Happiness
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this new printer! I am a quilter and it is amazing how many quilt patterns there are available free on the internet. I used to go through cartridge after expensive cartridge in my old printer. I have printed hundreds of pages and still have ink. I am happy with my purchase so far and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MADecker

customer_reviews.title: Great buy when costs over entire life-cycle considered
customer_reviews.text: Great printer! No setup or connectivity problems, and print jobs execute speedily with no delay. Previous printer was Pixma 6-cartridge model, and although its output quality was great, frequent printing delays for startup/clean cycles and the high cost of repeatedly replacing ink cartridges was just too frustrating. This Epson's output is slightly less crisp than the Canon at the same quality setting, but it's certainly acceptable, and I can always bump up the quality setting when needed. The joy of not having to worry about running out of ink or paying for expensive replacement cartridges more than offset the small degradation in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Adams

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this printer. I had some trouble getting it to connect to my wireless network but that was solved when I rebooted my router. This seems to be a good idea anytime you add a new network device. The printer is compact and it doesn't clatter and bang around like every other ink jet printer I have owned. We ordered some Epson photo paper at a bit over 7 cents a sheet. The photos are as good as any we have had printed at Walmart. I really like the idea of filling the printer with ink bottles, even buying the Epson ink is going to be much cheaper than using cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Two print head failures in two years, only 709 pages printed.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, this is a nice printer. I really like the idea of paying for the printer, not the ink. However, I bought this printer in Feb of 2016 and within the first year while it was still under warranty, the black print head failed. It was replaced with an entirely new printer. That printer now has 709 sheets printed, and the black print head has failed again. Both times, it's not that the head clogged and needed cleaning. The black head just completely stopped printing. Epson quality just seems to be getting worse and worse. I will not be buying any more Epson products.
customer_reviews.author: M. Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my HP printer!
customer_reviews.text: I threw out my hp printer because it was forcing me to use their expensive ink. I really like this printer. The ink lasts much longer and therefore is much less expensive. I have been trying different things to get a sharper print but haven't been able to as yet. It print documents great but a little hazey on the pictures that's the reason for four stars instead of five.
customer_reviews.author: Margie W

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, mostly works ok
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, mostly works ok. Occasionally isn't recognized by one of our laptops and has to be reset, but no problems with the desktop. It prints promptly (unlike the experience of some others). Color is good on premium paper. But the black nozzles continually get clogged which causes light bands. Cleaning (regular and power flush) helps but does not completely fix the problem, and then it gets worse again soon thereafter. Scanning software is functional but very clunky. The advantage of not having to replace ink cartridges probably outweighs these problems for everyday work. Hopefully the next generation of this concept will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Sprout

customer_reviews.title: Not as good color as a 6 ink photo printer but passable
customer_reviews.text: Not as good color as a 6 ink photo printer but passable. Very difficult set up software. Needs some way to print the directions so you can feel your way thru it. Never did get it on wifi, Had to use a cable. z At least the tank idea is good but they charge enough more that you could buy a lot of cartridges .
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick W.Paget

customer_reviews.title: Crapola
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer a couple of years ago, and as I recall it worked ok at first, but color prints always came out mostly blue from the start. This printer cannot print photos of any quality, and my kids’ school projects look worse than all the rest unless I go to a print shop (then why have a printer?). Now this printer is as good a printer as a boat anchor would be. Now I am running off to the print shop for the basic page print, or sending it to work to print from there. Will go back to print cartridges, this was a failed experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Aquaman

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great...for a few months. It’s true...you buy less ink. Because it stops working before you run out of the first batch! After a few months, it randomly started printing only in pink. Now it just pushes paper through and prints nothing. I’ve tried updating, rebooting, recalibrating...re-everything. All to no avail. I’ve had several Epson printers. This is the worst of the lot. I’m going back to Brother. I would not recommend this printer on any level.
customer_reviews.author: MissQuotable

customer_reviews.title: IT ARRIVED IN ONE DAY!!!  So Far...SO Good....No More ink cartridges!
customer_reviews.text: So Far, So Good...Works great..A bit time consuming to set up but so far, after over 100 pages of Black & White printing ALL but a tiny bit of ink levels still show full.I'll update if I remember at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: John Silvestri

customer_reviews.title: Print Quality Poor
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a Canon Pixma MG7720. I read LOTS of reviews. I decided print quality for my photos was most important, so weighing all the factors I read about, I decided on the Epson ET-2550. I bought quality Epson photo paper. Now I am printing some decent photos, but many that have "banding" throughout or, even after reducing the contrast with Photoshop, I am getting black shadows when they are not that dark on my screen. I got this printer 6 days ago and may return it. What an inconvenience - nothing really available locally. I can print better photos on the Canon that I intended to replace!
customer_reviews.author: SBU

customer_reviews.title: Best product I've bought this year!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute must have! I have had mine for six months use a whole lot of Hank and print a lot of pictures and can barely tell that I've used any ink at all so far. When I ordered the product I was skeptical so I ordered extra Ink for a total of $37 and don't think I'll be using it for another 6 to 8 months. If you're into quality prints and getting your moneys worth on a long lasting ink cartridges this is a no-brainer, by this printer you will be extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: BoobearTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money elsewhere.  Gets clogged and never works again.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. I thought this would an amazing printer that we would be able to use this printer for all duties including pictures. It worked OK...not great for a few months and then little by little we kept losing color even though all the ink levels were pretty high. Eventually, it just started printing blank pages. I tried to clean the head...its still just prints faintly. Just about ready to be rid of it. Spent way too much for what I thought was a good quality printer. I could have spent 1/3 the price and gotten better results. I wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Montenegro

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Epson products
customer_reviews.text: After about 9 months, it started to crash regularly. Tech support via Epson website totally useless. No response to issue save for a customer satisfaction survey. I called them as I sensed that they were stalling until the warrant had expired. They told me that it was out of warranty as the warranty period started on the day that Amazon bought the item from Epson, not the day that I bought it from Amazon. I will never buy another Epson product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick D Bacon

customer_reviews.title: We love it. The wireless connectivity makes it great for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. We love it. The wireless connectivity makes it great for printing directly from smartphone or ipad. I have had it about a week now and I can't wait to see how many sheets that I can print until needing to buy more ink. The old printer I had was going through $50 of cartridges about every 2 months with small amount of printing. I anticipate this printer to pay for itself in less than a year. What a great idea, i am glad that someone finally invented a printer like this. The cartridge ink thing is a big ripoff and this printer is the beginning of a new era in home printing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good Try!
customer_reviews.text: The visible paper and ink supplies are great, and no more ink cartridges, whoopee! But the lack of a simple, one button copy function spoils it a little. I shouldn't have to go thru several menus to make one lousy simple 8-1/2 x 11 B&W copy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: most notably a wide format printer and graphic design scanner and I have been pleased for the most part with the quality of thei
customer_reviews.text: I own a variety of Epson products, most notably a wide format printer and graphic design scanner and I have been pleased for the most part with the quality of their products but I must say that the ET-2550 is a dud!!!! The print time is FOREVER, it constantly says there are paper jams when it is not jammed and the machine rarely prints straight images. I bought because of Epson's reputation and because the printer was supposed to save money in the long run but all I'm doing is pulling my hair and and wondering how this POS is worthy of its price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Rgp

customer_reviews.title: Low quality printing and necessary to reboot in order to print
customer_reviews.text: This printer could not print black very well. For example any document would have lines and streaks throughout the text. Sometimes it would even be unreadable. Generally the print quality was only okay on it's best days. If the printer was left idle for a few days it would not print. When that happened I would have to pull the plug and plug it back in. After a few years the printer started throwing trouble codes for jammed paper. No amount of cleaning would clear the errors. Sometimes rebooting a bunch of times would allow you to print, other times no such luck.
customer_reviews.author: LI-SVT

customer_reviews.title: Use your printer without guilt or worry and scan things with ease!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. My biggest complaint with printers today is that once they run out of ink, you might as well buy a new printer because it costs about the same as replacing all the ink. This printer has so much ink, I can print off color pages for the kids as well as my homework and study guides and everything else I need to print without the cringe associated with using ink! We're had this printer for several months and it's been great. The scanning part is really good also. I scanned photographs for the first time and some of them were dark but they scanned in corrected and came out looking perfect on the screen. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: rocknmomx5

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from Epson
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 years with limited home use and the printer is dead. Contacted Epson tech support through the "Contact Us" button on epson.com. Somehow got connected with tech support in UK (at the time I thought that was where their support was located). After 3 months working with tech support I requested a refund. That is when they decided to inform me if I didn't purchase the printer in the UK or Ireland they could not help me that I had to contact US tech support. I forwarded the UK 3 month email thread to US tech support. US tech support has only offered me the run around and rehash solutions already tried.
customer_reviews.author: C. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: NEW AND DOESNT TURN ON
customer_reviews.text: i LIVE OUTSIE OF THE USA. BOUGHT THIS, ITS A GREAT DEAL, CONSIDERING I HAVE A SMALL OFFICE. WHEN I FINALLY GOT IT. THE PRINTER DOES NOT TURN ON I DONT KNOW WHAT IT HAS, AND I CANT RETURNED BECAUSE SHIPPING IT BACK TO THE US, WILL COST ME MORE THAN BUYING A NEW ONE. THAT IS THE RISK YOU TAKE WHEN BUYING FROM AMAZON. I WILL TRY ANOTHER BRAND TO SEE IF IT WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Gennys Restituyo

customer_reviews.title: Best printer
customer_reviews.text: It may be pricy but it has saved me A LOT when you consider you don't have to buy cartridges and I never get close for running out of ink because you can see the level of each reservoir. I will try making pictures on photo paper soon and check back in with that review later.
customer_reviews.author: D. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: this is the best printer I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to pay so much for a ink-jet printer, but after using it for a year, this is the best printer I have ever used. No more buying ink.. no more thinking about saving ink and not printing full color. after a year of constant printing.. i still have about 1/2 of initial ink left.. that has never happened with my previous printers.
customer_reviews.author: ewstudio

customer_reviews.title: Printer Head Plugs up if you Don't Use the Printer Regularly
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it uses bulk ink What I don't like is that if the printer sits a while, the print head nozzles begin to plug up and stop working. There is no good way to clean it, either. That is a huge liability to an otherwise decent idea.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Sure it doesn't have features that business printers have but like i said
customer_reviews.text: It can copy, scan, and print. It is a simple printer that get the job done. Sure it doesn't have features that business printers have but like i said, it gets the job done. Also it beats having to buy $30 ink cartridges that contain a few drops of ink. I haven't used this printer long enough to be sure but it seems like it will be cost efficient in the long run. Basically it is a good enough personal(not professional) printer for your home
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality at default settings
customer_reviews.text: While the ink does last a long time (I’ve had the printer for three years now and haven’t had to refill), the quality is awful. On normal settings I get a lot of gaps in the output. Only on premium settings do I get a good print but that uses a lot more ink. I would not buy this printer again.
customer_reviews.author: ybs

customer_reviews.title: Finally An Affordable Solution
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for months now and feel confident in its performance to be able to highly recommend it. I have printed both documents and photos in both color and black and white. The quality of them is superb, and I have not had to buy ink! The constant expense of ink cartridges has always been a pet peeve of mine, but now I am free of that. I recommend this printer for your home or office use.
customer_reviews.author: Calibrookian

customer_reviews.title: Filling the ink tanks was easy, but I was very cautious doing it
customer_reviews.text: After setting this printer up, I am really impressed with it! Filling the ink tanks was easy, but I was very cautious doing it, and had no problems with spilling ink. The quality of printing is very good, and the speed is also very good. I replaced a very good Canon printer with this printer....but the Canon printer used way too much ink! Although the initial cost of this printer is more, after about three ink refills with the Canon I would replace most of the cost of this Epson printer. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Efficient with ink
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very efficient with ink. I print color all the time and my ink lasted over a year before I had to buy more, and it was so inexpensive to buy more ink. Colors print fairly true, and I am able to choose paper settings so that the printer prints the right amount of ink for the paper it's printing on.
customer_reviews.author: Moondust Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far....good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our office as other ink jet printers are sooooo expensive for printing in color. We've had it a few months and have printed probably a 1,000 color copies by now. Still have a decent amount of ink left so happy with that. The color copies are just fine for our needs. This has already saved us money vs printing with traditional ink jet cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: montana

customer_reviews.title: Easy WiFi set up
customer_reviews.text: No more empty print cartridges after printing only a small number of pages that end up costing almost as much as the printer (an HP). This little printer has a long supply of ink tanks that are filled from a 70 mL refill kit. Ink seems to last forever. Easy WiFi set up. Out of the box and into service in about 2 hours. The only negative I have is that the paper handling is a little limited and flimsy but this printer cranks out the pages never the less.
customer_reviews.author: EAV

customer_reviews.title: BROKE 1 MONTH AFTER WARRANTY WAS UP
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until literally 1 month after warranty ended. Then all it would do was display "PAPER JAM ERROR". Did all the Epson support then read online that the sensors get misaligned and this error was common. The guy in Staples told me out of the 5 he sold 4 were returned and they weren't going to carry it anymore. Great idea though
customer_reviews.author: carol notine

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer and Awesome Value
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our printer! Set up was easy and it prints perfectly for my business! The print quality is excellent. I wouldn't recommend this printer for photos it does an ok job but it's not Premimum quaility. If you are printing Logos and colored words or documents this is the printer for you! I have been using it for almost a month and I haven't had an ounce of trouble! I will note that this is not an Air print printer. You can print from your iPad and iPhone but you have to have the app.
customer_reviews.author: S. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, too expensive for the issues I've had with it
customer_reviews.text: This printer is okay. I have a Macbook Pro and just recently started having an issue with duplex (two sided) printing. I was able, at one point, to print double sided, but now cannot. I've looked up tutorials and have spent way too much time messing around with this. Eco tank is great, I wish I could also be Eco conscious about paper. I have no idea why they would sell a printer that can print two sided easily on Windows and not a Mac, really irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 years going best printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over two years. I have printed thousands of pages with it. I have still never filled any of the ink. It just won't run out. I was used to ordering new printers every year when they would stop working and I was tired of buying the overpriced ink. While this costs more, it is SO worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN2000

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I have ever owned. Dependable, prints without issues. Nice little scanner too and it does not use up ink fast at all. I have been printing a lot of documents of late I set it to B&W and the indicator level hasn't moved. I had a Canon 5550 Series and when it did work, it sucked up ink and the ink cost more than the printer. It was not reliable. I have not had one minutes problem with this Printer. It is much faster than my Canon too.
customer_reviews.author: empi

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer since the end of January. It worked well, although not as best of quality as I would expect from this company. As of last week, the printer will no longer turn on. I have checked all connections and plugged it into different outlets. I am highly dissapointed and dissatisfied. I want to return it and get my money back. I would like to get directions on how to make this possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at home. High performance, very easy to set up, install and use. Completely met my needs and expectations. With 3 kids, we do a fair bit of scanning, printing pictures, documents, scanning and photocopying. This printer does it all very well. Sure there are printers that are superior in photo printing capabilities but for us, this one suffices. I like the ink tanks as they are long lasting compared to cartridges. Very happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The color copies are outstanding! I volunteer with a ...
customer_reviews.text: The color copies are outstanding! I volunteer with a nonprofit, and I don't have to take to a printer for copies that I need to hand out for an event. This printer is very close to the job a professional printing company would produce. A very impressive performance by this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Voelz

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome printer! Yes
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome printer! Yes, it was more than other printers to initially buy. With how much I have used it already, I would have already had to spend another $100 on ink with my HP Inkjet. With this, the tanks are only half empty plus the refills are so much more affordable. I love the wireless printing from my iPad or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Worst color printer I ever had
customer_reviews.text: The printing quality is so bad that the color get distorted. For example the red lines comes yellow and green lines print as grey. And quantity of the printing output is no where close to what they are advertising. My inks ran out after printing less than 1000 pages compared to 6000 pages what they are advertising. Total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: abul k. azad

customer_reviews.title: Best printer EVER
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best printer I have ever invested in. I had my doubts about the price but after my wife as printer over 2500 pages of random items it has definitely saved a ton on ink alone. It still has over half of its original ink in it. If you need a new printer this is a must have! Works great with my iPhone to print off of the home network.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Deaner

customer_reviews.title: If only it would print.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this POS. If you don't print for two days, it freezes and will not print. The power button never works, you have to unplug to get it to turn off. The networking is glitchy at best. It gets one star for the nice pages that print, when you can get it to print. Totally not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.author: goblueinga

customer_reviews.title: Network issues, slow printing, no automatic document feeder - but small and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've been pretty unimpressed by this printer so far. It seems to have constant network issues receiving print and scan jobs and it's very, very slow. I find myself ordering a page to print and then going downstairs to get breakfast while I wait. Not to mention not having an automatic document feeder is very frustrating. Very sad because I really wanted to love this. I'll revise at a different time if some of these issues end up getting resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D. Herald

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit through Amazon about a year ago. I don’t print much, but with previously my ink jet were always out of ink when I did go to print. I was spending literally $10’s of dollars per page. The Ecotank has been going strong, always ready and good print quality. I wouldn’t use this for photo-quality work, but for everyday color printing it’s awesome. My tanks are still more than half full with the one charge on install. So far it’s alreadybpaid for itself in ink cartridge savings. Newer models are out there, I’m sure even better!
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The directions were very clear and easy to follow as far as setting up the printer and WiFi settings. I am quite pleased with how it works with my network. My HP that I replaced never worked quite right. The Google Cloud Print capability is great. Update: It started to print lines throughout images. I followed all the maintenance steps and nothing has worked. Very frustrated due to how much I paid for this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: EcoTank Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first EcoTank printer. So far, after just a few months, I am very satisfied and love the idea of no more cartridges!!!!! I paid a bit more up front but I am thinking it will cost less in the long run. That was the premise for purchasing this particular printer and I am happy with that decision so far. The quality of the print is on par with the InkJet I owned prior to this printer. I have and will continue to recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is a bit slow but does a great job. I printed a 180 page manual with ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is a bit slow but does a great job. I printed a 180 page manual with color photos, using both sides of the paper without a single problem. Did not put a dent in the ink. This printer was long over due.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to not have to buy cartridges!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that I don't have to buy cartridges; and for that fact alone I put up with the poor print quality. This is not a printer for someone who wants or needs a sharp print quality. The color photo printing is very subpar, and the black printing is also not sharp. That being said, I don't do much of that kind of printing and so this printer works fine for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer. I use it in my home for personal and small business items. Have had it for over a year and it works great. Easy to refill ink cartridges, ink lasts a long time. Print quality is very good. Would recommend. I purchased a second one for my daughter who is in the real estate business.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Paper Jammed
customer_reviews.text: It is not even a year old and it continuous to say Paper Jamed.. Where? took it to a shop. They said throw it away. i purchase it for 300.00 and it is not even a year old.
customer_reviews.author: DonitaBird

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the refillable ink feature
customer_reviews.text: I am very dissatisfied with this copier. I absolutely love the refillable ink feature. That is really a great feature. However, to be advertised for office work I believe it should have the capability to print on 11x14 paper. That is not an option with this copier. And now it refuses to pull paper for printing. I have tried conceivable way to load the paper so it will feed but to no avail. I wish I could get our money back!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia O.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this printer!!  Good idea fails miserably.
customer_reviews.text: View the other "one star" reviews as they cover the issues (and I've seen all of them beginning about 7 months after my purchase) I won't waste any more time on what is obviously a poorly executed printer design.
customer_reviews.author: Dale J. Bjorklund

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. I'm going to recommend we get these at work when we need to replace printers. The money you will save on ink is astonishing. It's about time someone broke the hold those ridiculously expensive ink cartridges have on everyone. The speed is just fine for normal printing. Probably get the higher end printer for the office use. I have it set to maximum quality print and the ink has barely gone down at all.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre network printer, useless as a scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of the large ink tanks and low cost for ink replacement compared to other printers. Unfortunately the network operation of this device is pretty finicky. Usually takes a couple of tries to print. As a scanner it is absolutely useless. I'm not sure if the problem is the printer or Epson's terrible software but it crashes constantly requiring a restart of the scanner and whatever you are trying to scan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have printed over two packs of paper and my colored inks are still pretty full and my black ink has only used a ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in grad school and I print off journals, articles and study guides every week. With my old printer, I was buying ink every other week. I have printed over two packs of paper and my colored inks are still pretty full and my black ink has only used a forth of the ink. Absolutely love this printer.
customer_reviews.author: blubutterflies89

customer_reviews.title: Finally they figure out that people are not ink dummies.
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend it. Especially since the ink can be replaced easily and the ink bottles have a great yield; they finally figured out that people are not dummies who will dish out 40 dollars for ink cartridges that only printed a few pages. Remember to print at least one page a week to keep the head of this printer and any other inkjet printer in shape. That is no issue since printing with this inkjet is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Severo

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this printer! It was purchased to replace an HP Photosmart that was having numerous issues. It was extremely easy to set up & get connected to our wireless network. Filling the ink tanks was not as difficult as I was expecting it to be. The printer itself is lightweight & compact, it takes up less space than the HP did. And finally, the printing itself: it prints quickly, no smudging, and both print and pictures appear crisp & bold. The hefty price tag is worth it in my opinion, and I will be recommending it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Siefert

customer_reviews.title: I hate it! It takes to long to load information ...
customer_reviews.text: I hate it! It takes to long to load information and pokes along in printing. Quality of print is very poor, I can not get the lines out of it. I would not purchase this brand again. I will stick with HP.
customer_reviews.author: ecklinda

customer_reviews.title: Great for school, work, and home office. just good on photo's.
customer_reviews.text: Prints well and its nice not having to worry about ink running out after 10 pages. No the ink is not best for printing your family album. You are probably best using an online service for photo's since they will have the proper printers, inks, and papers. What this is good for is school, work and home office. Scans good, copies good, prints good. All legible without smudging. The printer app and setup to the wireless network was not hard and seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: One year later and my printer doesn’t work well at ...
customer_reviews.text: One year later and my printer doesn’t work well at all. The color is so off. I’m so frustrated trying to fix it. I guess I was hoping this printer would have lasted longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had been messing with a csi for years. Epson printers really had a problem with those and kept not recognizing the continuous feed cartridges, but I loved the savings. Now Epson has finally gotten on board and this printer works like a charm. Only had it for a couple of months but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Sleek design so it doesn't take up too much space. Performs smoothly. I love that it uses tank reservoirs for the ink instead of having to install cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Neph

customer_reviews.title: Set up is easy thanks to wireless connectivity and excellent software CD
customer_reviews.text: Until we got this printer, we needed two -- one for cheap black & white general printing and another printer for costly inkjet color printing. However, the cost of ink cartidges and their longevity was a serious problem. Now we have one printer for all jobs and cost is just what we have searched for over the years. Color Photos are precise and ink is inexpensive. Set up is easy thanks to wireless connectivity and excellent software CD. Printer purchase price was very reasonable. No mess ink tank refilling and no need for messy, self refilling of color cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Don Loro

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 3 printers in a very short time. Not only is this thing handling paper and card stock better than any of the other more expensive ones, it's toner lasts forever! Even if it ran out, the ink is super cheap. I think the only thing that was really odd to me is when it prints, the paper is cold instead of hot like others.
customer_reviews.author: Flamekin

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this not to long ago and right away ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this not to long ago and right away the printer paper began to have lines. The paper always got jammed and has issues with this printer. I've bought cheaper brands that have lasted longer than this as this printer only lasted a couple months. I tried getting a refund or to return and get my money back but can't.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Have an Epson NX625 an it still works great.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Had about 4 months and color stopped working. Now it won't print at all. Even when it worked it was very SLOW. Have an Epson NX625 an it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lockman

customer_reviews.title: really poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: really poor print quality. streaks and lines through printed page. I would not recommend this printer at all especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: What I thought was a good deal in ink savings turns out to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer for 1 1/2 yr ago for general use, nothing too straining. I bought for the name and also for the longevity of the ink. The printer is now dead and cannot be repaired. What I thought was a good deal in ink savings turns out to be a bad deal in hardware failure. The print quality was also not that great
customer_reviews.author: Kurt H Simon

customer_reviews.title: It is a good printer
customer_reviews.text: The Ink lasts a long time and the print quality is very good. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Iver Arrieta

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been working great! It was easy to set up. Just follow the directions and I had it up and running within an hour. The way the tanks hold the ink makes it so that it won't run out of ink as long as I fill the tank regularly. It was well worth the price because the ink is so much cheaper than the cartridges. I'm very happy I purchased this printer.
customer_reviews.author: soccernut 77

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: No cartridges, YAY. By now I would have purchased at least one set and probably 2 sets. This shows ink barely used. Easy to set up, took a little time works great. My favorite Epson died about a month ago and could no longer be fixed. (Parts not available.) This one is quickly replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: I love not having to stress about "wasting" ink
customer_reviews.text: I love not having to stress about "wasting" ink! Very easy to set up and the print quality is excellent. I do keep another printer for jobs that have to be photo quality and I love not having to use that one for everyday printing. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Blulili7274

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Epsopn L series printed when I liven in Latin America and this one works as good as the L-series eco-printer. It gives us good quality printing and the best part is the affordable ink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is a great printer. Just always keep the ink tanks completely full.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is exceptional the price I paid for it I found it for less in other places.
customer_reviews.author: firewalker

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: We like this product but we were confused by the instructions telling us not to fill above the line and never to let it go below the line. Very strange request, but so far it has done well. Compact and easy to setup
customer_reviews.author: digitalbeachbum

customer_reviews.title: Mine was junk...
customer_reviews.text: I love printing my photos. That's what the supertanker does all day long. Thank You, Epson. Buy, Print, Love. Unfortunately only 80 color prints later it was over. Streaky prints and no amount of service has produced another useable print. Epson has no customer service. So, what to do...???
customer_reviews.author: avery

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: While you pay more for the printer, the savings on ink and the convenience of not having to change cartridges so often really makes up for it. At this point I really wish I had spend the money for the higher end model with more speed, But I am basically satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: too early to tell but we think we like it. does make a slight
customer_reviews.text: too early to tell but we think we like it. does make a slight, very high pitch noise at the end of every print job. not sure what that's all about. Hope it saves on ink! Was very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: Color isn't as vivid as I thought it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Color isn't as vivid as I thought it would be. Maybe it's just the linen paper I have. But also, the hoper doesn't hold much paper.
customer_reviews.author: The Honorable Rico Smith

customer_reviews.title: Epson Customer service was terrible. Anyone want to buy it from me
customer_reviews.text: Never printed correctly since I purchased it. Epson Customer service was terrible. Anyone want to buy it from me?
customer_reviews.author: Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Good for families
customer_reviews.text: Nice photo prints, easy to set up and the eco tanks are great. We are using this printer in our household for almost a year without any hiccups or problems. Prints from anything ( Phones, computers, tablets) even from Japanese Mac book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty weak printer. The first one I purchased kept on freezing. I returned it and they sent another. Hooked the printer up to my wireless network and it passed all checks. BUT nothing (PC's, iPad, etc.) can find it. The software to connect the PC to the printer would have been "old" back in 1990. Very frustrating. If it wasn't so expensive, I likely would have throw it out already.
customer_reviews.author: John F Lillis Jr

customer_reviews.title: I like the large ink tanks
customer_reviews.text: I like the large ink tanks. However, I've wasted so much paper and ink due black splotches of ink occuring at the bottom of any card stock I try to print on. The card stock is lightweight, just 80#. FRUSTRATING!!!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Specialist, OCD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this printer I've only had it a short time but it was so easy to set up and start using. It was a breeze to fill the ink reservoirs. No problem or mess at all if you are just careful and pay attention. The print copy quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E.

customer_reviews.title: We love the idea of the refillable ink tanks
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the new printer about two months with no problems. We love the idea of the refillable ink tanks, but have not used it enough to determine how much more economical it will be over our previous printers. The quality is at least as good. The scan and copy controls are different, but just need getting used to. So far we are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Isenberg

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi, poor print quality despite expensive price.
customer_reviews.text: This printer drops wifi connection every day. I have to restart every day if I want to print something. I've never had that problem, have reloaded software multiple times, but it just does not work well. The printer is expensive and we thought, for the price the print quality would be good. Has the advantage of refillable ink reservoirs would be worth the price. The quality is mediocre, at best. We've checked and reset the ink and colors and it just is not good. This is probably be the last Epson we buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Print Away Kids!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an ink jet printer for home office use and general printing. I was tired of spending a lot of money on ink cartridges. This product fit the bill. Although cost about 100 more up front, it pays for itself within about 12 months but lasts over 2 years. Prints well and now I don't worry about using ink. Print away kids!
customer_reviews.author: Susan JP Spence

customer_reviews.title: My new found love.
customer_reviews.text: Bought my printer in November been using it ever since. Use it to print pictures the quality is amazing. Love it and haven't found any problem with it to date. The ink will definitely last a while before it needs refilling.
customer_reviews.author: Jamaican Queen

customer_reviews.title: The printer is good, The color prints do not work properly
customer_reviews.text: The printer is good, The color prints do not work properly. for the $$ this product cost I would expect it to work without any issues, Also if you change the wifi name the whole setup is broken. I do not suggest to buy.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: The Tops!
customer_reviews.text: Tops. Best printer, scanner, copier I've ever owned. Loved not having to buy cartridges all the time. Been over a year and I still have not had to buy ink. Use on wifi too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Agility

customer_reviews.title: Finally an economical printer!
customer_reviews.text: Very economical and easy to use. Have used another brand of printer for many years, but are way to expensive to operate. I like this printer and I think anyone that prints many pages will too.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I am so happy to be done with the cartridges! Filling the ink tanks is worth it to me, especially in avoiding the scams all of the printer companies have going with their print cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Dwyer

product_meta.title: Epson Expression ET-2550 EcoTank Wireless Color All-in-One Supertank Printer with Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi Direct, Tablet and Smartphone Printing, Easily Refillable Ink Tanks
product_meta.description: Style:New PrinterThe Expression ET-2550 Eco Tank wireless all-in-one printer comes loaded and ready with up to 2 years of ink in the box(1). That's a huge amount of ink - enough to print up to 4000 black/6500 color pages(2), and equivalent to about 20 ink cartridge sets(3). It delivers unbeatable convenience with ultra low-cost replacement ink bottles and innovative refillable ink tanks. Count on it to be ready when you are. The revolutionary ET-2550 features built-in wireless and Wi-Fi Direct4, plus easy printing from iPad, iPhone, tablets and smartphones5. It features a 1.44" color LCD, and PC-free photo printing with a built-in memory card slot
feature_bullets: Epson strongly recommends the use of Genuine Epson inks for a quality printing experience. Non Epson inks and inks not formulated for your specific printer may cause damage that is not covered by the Epson warranty.
Cartridge-Free Printing and comes with up to 2 years of ink in the box(1).
Includes enough ink to print up to 4,000 black/6,500 color pages(2).
Small size, great performance, 1.4" Color LCD, easily refillable ink tanks.
(1) Based on average monthly print volumes of about 150 pages.

(2) Yields based on the ISO/IEC 24712 pattern with Epson’s methodology. Actual ink yields will vary considerably for reasons including images printed, print settings, temperature and humidity. Yields may be lower when printing infrequently or predominantly with one ink color. All ink colors are used for printing and printer maintenance, and all colors must be available for printing. For more information, visit epson.com/cartridgeinfo.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars655 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
